post_text: Earlier today we participated in the weekly leadership call that the Dept. of Education / Office of Charter Schools hosts. There is no additional information from the Governor’s office at this time related to school reopening options, though it was mentioned that new guidance could be coming next week. What this means for now is that Plan A (all students return for full days, every day) is not an option for schools to implement at this time as it not possible to have all students on campus at the same time and still adhere to the health and safety guidelines required by NCDHHS. As mentioned earlier this week, we will have more details on how we intend to open with Plan B (face-to-face plus remote) and Plan C (fully online) provided to you next week. The reopening of schools this year is unprecedented and a herculean effort. For our scholars, we will put their academic and health needs first, and we will be successful, but it will require all of us as a PSPA community to work together in a spirit of support, flexibility, patience, and grace.

Show your support for our graduating 8th Graders!
We would love to show our school wide support for our first ever graduating 8th grade class, who will be having a drive-thru graduation ceremony. While the only people that can attend the ceremony are our graduates and their families there is another way you can show your support! Thus, we are reaching out to YOU- our school community. Please consider decorating a yard sign for our 8th graders for their drive-thru graduation ceremony- we know they would love to see your support!! Blank signs can be found online, at Wal-Mart, or you could even recycle the backside of an old one! You can make them for one particular student, or in support for the whole class! Please drop off your signs and yard stakes in the bus loop circle on June 2nd from 11-1PM. There will be someone there to collect your sign and then add it to the carline prior to their graduation ceremony! Thank you in advance for supporting our 8th graders during this time!
